entry.title: Quantum Innovation Center Internship 2025
entry.content: Emma Bennett and Minasadat Attari landed a funded summer internship (June ‚Äì Aug 2025) at the University of Missouri‚Äôs Quantum Innovation Center. They‚Äôll be teaming up on an interdisciplinary project that fuses quantum-computing methods with biomedical vascular-graph analysis. Congrats, Emma and Mina‚Äîcan‚Äôt wait to see the quantum-powered results!

They‚Äôll be teaming up on an interdisciplinary project that fuses quantum-computing methods with biomedical vascular-graph analysis. Congrats, Emma and Mina‚Äîcan‚Äôt wait to see the quantum-powered results!

entry.title: üéâ GSA Show Me Class Project Award ‚Äì 2nd Place

link.title: üéâ GSA Show Me Class Project Award ‚Äì 2nd Place

entry.content: Congratulations to Sara Shojaei and Emma Bennett from MAVI Lab for winning 2nd place at the Graduate Student Association (GSA) Show Me Class Project event! Their project focused on segmentation and graph representation from satellite imagery, aiming to minimize mergers and fragmentations for more accurate and clean results. Using the refined segmentation masks, they extracted optimal graph structures to enable fast, robust, and reliable image-based localization under varying environmental conditions. Great work, Sara and Emma!
entry.summary: Congratulations to Sara Shojaei and Emma Bennett from MAVI Lab for winning 2nd place at the Graduate Student Association (GSA) Show Me Class Project event! Their project focused on segmentation and graph representation from satellite imagery, aiming to minimize mergers and fragmentations for more accurate and clean results. Using the refined segmentation masks, they extracted optimal graph structures to enable fast, robust, and reliable image-based localization under varying environmental conditions. Great work, Sara and Emma!

entry.title: Dr. Filiz Bunyak Earns Junior Faculty Excellence in Teaching Award

link.title: Dr. Filiz Bunyak Earns Junior Faculty Excellence in Teaching Award

entry.content:
Our lab congratulates Dr. Filiz Bunyak Ersoy on receiving the University of Missouri‚Äôs Junior Faculty Excellence in Teaching Award.

Dr. Bunyak‚Äîwho teaches Digital Image Processing, Computer Vision, and the new Deep Learning for Advanced Computer Vision course‚Äîwas recognized for her clear, engaging lectures and the supportive classroom environment she creates. Students praise both her depth of knowledge and her ability to make complex topics approachable.

Congratulations, Dr. Bunyak! üéâ
entry.summary: Our lab congratulates Dr. Filiz Bunyak Ersoy on receiving the University of Missouri‚Äôs Junior Faculty Excellence in Teaching Award.

entry.title: üéâ Congrats to Mina Attari ‚Äì Graduate Winner at Show Me Research Week 2025!

link.title: üéâ Congrats to Mina Attari ‚Äì Graduate Winner at Show Me Research Week 2025!

entry.content:
Big congratulations to Minasadat Attari for receiving the Graduate Winner Award at the 2025 Show Me Research Week!

Mina‚Äôs impressive research stood out at Mizzou‚Äôs flagship event celebrating innovation and scholarship. We‚Äôre proud to have her represent MAVI Lab‚Äîwell done, Mina!
entry.summary: Big congratulations to Minasadat Attari for receiving the Graduate Winner Award at the 2025 Show Me Research Week!

entry.title: Poster Presentation at MU Show-Me Research Week 2025

link.title: Poster Presentation at MU Show-Me Research Week 2025

entry.content:
Sara Shojaei presented ‚ÄúAdaptive Structure-Aware Connectivity-Preserving Loss for Improved Road Segmentation in Remote Sensing Images‚Äù at MU‚Äôs Show-Me Research Week 2025.

During the poster session in Columbia, Missouri, Sara shared her latest results on keeping road networks intact in satellite-image segmentation. The work drew interest from students, faculty, and industry visitors alike. Great job bringing MAVI Lab research to the campus community, Sara!
entry.summary: Sara Shojaei presented ‚ÄúAdaptive Structure-Aware Connectivity-Preserving Loss for Improved Road Segmentation in Remote Sensing Images‚Äù at MU‚Äôs Show-Me Research Week 2025.

entry.title: Presentations at SPIE 2025!
entry.content:
Congratulations to Emma Bennett for presenting two of her research projects at SPIE Defense and Commercial Sensing 2025! Emma delivered oral presentations at the SPIE Defense and Commercial Sensing Conference in Kissimmee, Florida (April 2025) on:

  • ‚ÄúBag-of-Graph-Attributes and Sparse Graph Structures for Efficient UAV Localization in Complex Environments‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúAerial Visual Localization Through Novel Applications of Weisfeiler-Lehman Graph Embeddings‚Äù

Fantastic work, Emma! üëè

entry.title: Poster Presentation at Show Me Research Week 2025

link.title: Poster Presentation at Show Me Research Week 2025

entry.content:
Emma Bennett presented her poster at MU Show-Me Research Week 2025.

During the poster session in Columbia, Missouri (April 2025), Emma shared ‚ÄúDeep Learning in the Field: Vision Transformers and CNNs for UAV-Based Soybean Canopy Analysis.‚Äù The project demonstrates how combining Vision Transformers with CNNs can enhance accuracy and speed in large-scale agricultural monitoring using UAV imagery.

Good job, Emma!
entry.summary: Emma Bennett presented her poster at MU Show-Me Research Week 2025.

entry.title: Oral Presentation at WACV 2025
entry.content: Sara Shojaei gave an oral presentation on ‚ÄúAdaptive Structure-Aware Connectivity-Preserving Loss for Improved Road Segmentation in Remote Sensing Images‚Äù at WACV 2025. At the Winter Conference on Applications of Computer Vision (WACV) in Tucson, Arizona, Sara outlined a new loss function that keeps road networks intact in satellite images. Great job representing MAVI Lab!
entry.summary: Sara Shojaei gave an oral presentation on ‚ÄúAdaptive Structure-Aware Connectivity-Preserving Loss for Improved Road Segmentation in Remote Sensing Images‚Äù at WACV 2025. At the Winter Conference on Applications of Computer Vision (WACV) in Tucson, Arizona, Sara outlined a new loss function that keeps road networks intact in satellite images. Great job representing MAVI Lab!

entry.title: Poster Presentation at WACV 2025
entry.content:
Sara Shojaei also presented a poster on the same work during WACV 2025.

In the poster session, Sara shared how cleaner segmentation masks and graph-based localization improve accuracy under changing environmental conditions. Congratulations, Sara!
entry.summary: Sara Shojaei also presented a poster on the same work during WACV 2025.

entry.title: Poster Presentation at Mizzou AI Symposium 2025

link.title: Poster Presentation at Mizzou AI Symposium 2025

entry.content:
Tom, Trevor, and Sara presented ‚ÄúAI-Driven Building and Road Segmentation in Remote Sensing Images: Balancing Accuracy, Boundary Clarity, and Connectivity‚Äù at the Mizzou AI Symposium 2025.

At the January symposium in Columbia, Missouri, the trio showcased their latest results on improving building and road segmentation with AI, highlighting techniques that boost accuracy while preserving crisp boundaries and network connectivity. Great teamwork, Tom, Trevor, and Sara!
entry.summary: Tom, Trevor, and Sara presented ‚ÄúAI-Driven Building and Road Segmentation in Remote Sensing Images: Balancing Accuracy, Boundary Clarity, and Connectivity‚Äù at the Mizzou AI Symposium 2025.
